instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: This macbook came in wet, after cleaning , its powering with image but no backlight , I quickly ran a diode mode reading on the big caps and 1067 which does not show any short , Can I please get some help ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 5, 18, 17, 11.

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
, <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>

PIN 5 = 5V 
PIN 18 = 5V
PIN 17 = 3.28V
PIN 11= 10.91V

NO, I have not tried a good known LCD yet since I can see imagines. on this one.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: Let me know what's the next step. sorry my typos ,  I meant to type Images.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R8450</RESISTOR>-53 and their traces.
Post voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines.

Testing with known good LCD assembly is the best to do.
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> gets the backlight adjust from T-CON.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8450</RESISTOR>/SCL = 0.466   and 4.61V 

<RESISTOR>R8453</RESISTOR> = .0466  AND 5.15V 

<RESISTOR>R8451</RESISTOR> /SDA =0.466= 4.5V

SCL  = 4.61V  

SDA = 4.55V 

All traces are  no damaged or corroded ic, Resistor or caps all is looking clean .I dont have another lcd to test but i continue to see images with a bright light, let me know what's next please 

Thank you.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: Just Cuious, i got a loose <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> lcd here , I have one test cable do you think the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> would be ok for the test? the fpc connector is looking the same as the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I dont know if that would work at least that would give me an idea of whats going on .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: Just to give you a heads up, in fact the lcd is my issue , I did the test with my <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> lcd  And yes backlight system works perfectly fine.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: Then you have a problem with T-CON, or backlight flex/LED strips of your <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD assembly.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: can that be repaired or should i just get a whole new screen?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
You can at least inspect backlight connector on the T-CON board.
Also may have only flexgate issue; easy to fix.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message: Really , do you have any tutorial for the flex gate ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
threads.message:
Usually you should note backlight reaction when moving the lid.
If flex is completely broken, may totally lose the backlight.
Youtube is full with flex gate videos; just search.
However, your problem may be different.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO Backlight after water damaged
